The Mismanagement and Destruction of Overwatch is a sad tale, and quite the long one, so let's get started. 2016, advertising and hype has been in overdrive, OVERWATCH IS FINALLY HERE!!! Its a brand new game from Blizzard entertainment of all studios! Its stylish, flashy, fun first, and super unique. You buy it and you have an absolute blast! Over the next few weeks, months, even years Overwatch is your go-to past time. Its one of THE video games, a whole hobby in of itself for you and you couldn't be happier. One of the best parts is how often you get rewarded too. Not only was the gameplay fun, it was full of goals and unlocks! "Just a few more coins and I'll get that dope skin I've wanted" or "man, if I finish this round of placements I'll unlock my next gold gun!" and other such thoughts are always at the forefront of your mind, it feels great. New characters were free too! They didn't try to milk you for cash or waste countless hours of your life with synthetic barriers nobody wanted or enjoyed, they just gave you more content for the thing you already paid for. And man, the dev update videos! A development team having a presence in their community? actually interacting with their players and communicating the process of creating this awesome game? Such a nice breath of fresh air! However, something had been happening, something bad. A few years in, and its been impossible to ignore balancing has gone downhill. The developers keep making nonsensical decisions and pushing away from the fun design that made the game popular in the first place. They keep pushing these esports streams nobody attends or watches, and new character additions have started slowing down. Not to mention terrible reworks like the eighty different forms Symmettra has had at that point. Worst of all, the dev team isn't sharing as much as they used to. They aren't talking as much as they should be. WHAT was going on? Flash forward a few more years, Overwatch doesn't get updates anymore, it feels like a dead and barren wasteland. You've gone through more unbearable and painful metas than shits you'll take in your whole life. The devs don't say anything anymore, but hey, they're still making cool skins for you to collect or buy right? Suddenly, out of the radio silence, Jeff Kaplan the icon himself! He assures you all with an epic new cinematic reveal and presentation that golden pastures are just on the horizon! Amazing new things are coming! Tons of new content like characters and a dedicated PVE!? With PROGRESSION!? More skins and events and gameplay updates taking the game back to where it should be! An engine upgrade to making everything look beautiful AND to improve the lives and speed of developers! Everything you could ever imagine and more! Jeff Kaplan quits. Shortly after the grand reveal, the face of the dev team leaves, following after a seemingly infinite line of other developers who had been doing the same. Well...that can't be good. But don't worry everyone, Jeff is replaced by someone Activision trusts very much, Aaron Keller, who assures us the game hasn't lost its way and everything will be as they've constantly promised. Oh, and forget about all those litigations, legal trials, lawsuits, and similar events the company has been dealing with lately, none of that is important silly gamer. Besides its all cleared up now, they changed the name of a fictional character that had literally nothing to do with any of the crimes and events in question! Makes sense! Flash forward a bit further and its here! Overwatch 2 is finally here! Its just like back in 2016 all over again, you've never been so excited! Oh but...Overwatch 1 is gone now? why? Ah well, doesn't matter Overwatch 2 is supposed to be the same but better! Oh, but...one of the core modes is gone? And all those maps were removed? And we got a boring mode, Push, as its replacement where you spend half your time walking? And pve was delayed? ah well, it'll come eventually, they just need more time! But...only two new characters after years of waiting for new content? And...there's a premium shop now? why is everything so expensive? where are my lootboxes? I didn't support gambling or anything but I got so many so often for free I never really HAD to pay for them before...now I can't get skins for free? And I have to buy new characters? But they were free for years, since 2016...and the game is buggier than its ever been? And what's with all these weird balance changes? And its only 5v5 now instead of 6v6? I knew that was coming but why doesn't the game feel properly balanced around the team change? And...WHAT!? player levels are gone? WHY!? Literally what possible sense could there be in removing player levels?? Ah, but you wouldn't figure this all out until hours and hours, or a day, after Overwatch 2's launch as the servers were completely and utterly busted. You try to make it work, even buy a battlepass or two. The game feels terrible though, but it gets better. Actually feels fun even at times as the balance improves, albeit at the pace of a slug. And hey this new Kiriko chick is rad! Maybe things aren't so bad afterall! Then, it happens, Overwatch 2's pve is almost entirely cancelled. 90% of what you've been promised for YEARS is taken away. The salt in the wound coming over the next few days, where its revealed Blizzard KNEW they had no plans to fulfill their promises for months and months and months but LIED to players and falsely advertised the future of their live service; what should be a crime. Shortly after though, Blizzard makes more promises (after failing to stick with their extremely simple, light, and basic roadmap for content) that the new season INVASION is gonna change everything. Its gonna bring the game back! And Hell, Blizzard games are gonna be on Steam now too! Overwatch being the very first to do so, this is big stuff everyone. The day comes, you've danced for hours, overjoyed after uninstalling Overwatch from Battle.Net and pre-loading on Steam, freed from the chains of a garbage and inferior launcher. The following morning you launch Overwatch on Steam for the first time to check out this amazing new soft launch Blizzard has hyped up, smiling away as your countless achievements register on your Steam account. The new skins and themes are sick! There's a new pve event for free and that pve campaign they promised is a fiftieth of what it should be but sounds super rad all the same! The new mode seems great too, a return to form on a grander scale! And dang, that new character is actually insanely fun, it didn't take long in the training range to come to that conclusion! This really might be the rebirth Overwatch 2 needed! You go ahead and buy the Invasion Ultimate bundle. You feel a bit like a sucker, giving them your money yet again, but for the first time in a long time you actually have hope. Then...you realize the game won't register you own all that dlc. Conveniently though, they still took your money. Ah well, they'll fix it right? At least the servers are working this time. You try the pve event and its....boring. The same old stupid ai you've killed a trillion times now in events over the years, just ever so slightly improved. Your only reward of note is a single skin, but you have to wait weeks for more challenges and levels to become available for arbitrary reasons; a desperate and pathetic attempt to keep you playing. The Flashpoint game mode? Well its actually pretty dang fun, but....there's only two maps for it. Two. The new character? Great actually! A trillion times better than the last one and tons of fun, so nice of them to let everybody demo her during the launch event (it was a bug). Hours and hours later though, you still don't have what you paid for, your property still not given to you. Turns out, nobody has it, there's barely any content, pve is still garbage, and nothing has changed. Overwatch is dead, and Blizz/Activision killed it. Slowly. Run the other way.

Yeah.. Ive loved overwatch since 2016, great game, fun gameplay just pure fun. Waiting for a new hero to play as was always fun, now to play heros you gotta pay or wait. Overwatch 2 released without the promised PVE gamemode because it wasn't in their interest anymore. They finally released some PVE content now but honestly its far too late and now it costs. Yeah its free to play but the whole game is pay this pay that. Sick of that nonsense. Use to be an S-tier game, now its an E-Tier game. Its fun but for players who have been with this game and blizzard for years, its a massive backstab. Greedy ass companies.
Change to positive when Kotick in jail

I'll put in as much effort in this review as they did the ga-

Yes, the pve changes suck.
Yes, making the new pve content mostly paid sucks.

But I still think overwatch is a fun FPS and the team unfortunately have a trash management team that made those choices.

Is this game fun? Yeah, honestly in my opinion, it's one of my favorite multiplayer shooters in general. However, just because it's one of my favorites doesn't mean it's immune to its fair share of criticism. This game is a shameless cash-grab that attempts to try and fulfill any false promises they make by implementing what they promised in the most half-a**ed way humanly possible. They completely took everything that was special about Overwatch 1 and took it behind the barn to take it out of its misery. This game is NOT the Overwatch you remember, it is NOT the same Overwatch you and the boys would play back in 2016. If you're willing to put up with not only some of the most aggressive and harmful use of microtransactions you will ever see in a video game, but also supporting the troubled and controversial game studio that created this absolute Frankenstein of what once was a really fun shooter, then you will find a pretty fun game. At the end of the day it's still Overwatch, but I would recommend you find literally any other title on Steam to play.

While this game has its ups and downs (weird balance changes,unwise executive decisions and all that), it's still incredibly fun to play. Some will compare it to tf2 however, the more competitive nature and the constantly changing meta result in this game being a far different experience from the chaotic 12v12 (no one plays comp don't bring it up) nature of tf2. Regardless, i'd probably rate this game a 7/10, certainly needs some changes stat but other than that it's quite enjoyable

Overwatch 1 was WAY more fun than this.

We had free events almost every season when this game was released, and I get it that the company wanted to make more money, but releasing the same quality as the content that once were free is a nasty tactic. I get it that you want to sell this as a "new game mode" but it isn't new at all. A fancy menu to interact with PvE missions doesn't worth the price you charge.
